website_summaries.verdict: It's hard to go wrong with this popper! Provides delicious results in minutes and works with different quality levels of popcorn. The best value.
pros: Stands out from competitors for its ability to work super well with both regular and gourmet popcorn
cons: You have to keep an eye on it!
May find a few burned kernels at the bottom if left alone

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this model - no on/off button
customer_reviews.text: Don’t like it, knowing what I now know, I would not buy it: 1. It had no on/off button - must plug in & pull plug to get it on or off. That is really irritating as well as impractical. 2. You have to pull the “roof” off of it to measure out an appropriate amount of popcorn kernels and dump them in. Hate that. 3. It got so hot it partially melted the plastic top. Had a sunbeam for 20 years, wish they still made that old machine....
customer_reviews.author: efud

customer_reviews.title: but it's still great. It does the job
customer_reviews.text: So, I've​ previously owned Poplite Air Corn Poppers and have tried other models as well, but do prefer the older, previous version. I believe it's the way that it's shaped that allows this particular popper to spew it out of the machine, aiming at everything that isn't the bowl, but it's still great. It does the job!
customer_reviews.author: elaine

customer_reviews.title: This machine pops great! It's very loud
customer_reviews.text: This machine pops great! It's very loud, powerful, and can get really hot really fast. Functionality: If you don't put enough kernels into the cavity, it won't pop correctly. All you have to do is pour in the kernels and plug it in. Make sure you have a large bowl ready. Taste: I love that it's a healthy option but boy, does it taste different from popping with oil. It took us a while to get used to. We add powdered popcorn flavors to this or spray oil and salt onto it. I recommend this machine as a healthy alternative! We use it once a week.
customer_reviews.author: DS

customer_reviews.title: Shakes too much!
customer_reviews.text: Popper if great except when turned on it vibrates too much causing it to "walk" across the counter! Someone has to stand there and hold it to keep it from moving. Our older model didn't do that, but beware on this one. Tried putting a non-skid pad underneath, but didn't really help.
customer_reviews.author: rmh_woody

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: The only flaw I can find with my new popcorn popper is the absence of a on/off switch. You plug it in and unplug it, and the this drives my OCD side nuts! However, I am definitely still giving this a 5 star. This popper pops twice as much popcorn in one batch as my last one, does it quicker, and only leaves maybe 2 kernels I popped. It’s amazing! We’re ver happy with this popper!
customer_reviews.author: Angela

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Popper!
customer_reviews.text: The Presto Poplite Air Popper pops perfect popcorn every time! I would give five stars if it had an on-off switch; that said, I still love this popper.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The popper works great but there is no way to add seasoning or salt while popping. It must be added after. Unfortunately since no oil is used, it doesn't stick to the popcorn. The popcorn is very bland. Also, there is no way to make less than a HUGE bowl. If you put in less popcorn it spits the kernels all over.
customer_reviews.author: Jane Proctor

customer_reviews.title: Makes great air popped corn
customer_reviews.text: This popper is exactly what I was hoping for. I use it often and have never been disappointed. If they could find a way to make these more quiet, that would be ideal, but either way, I'm quite happy with mine.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer W.

customer_reviews.title: It is terrific
customer_reviews.text: Neat and straightforward. Works with no steps or extra anything. Literally add corn and get popcorn in five minutes. Seriously. If you don’t melt butter on top you don’t even have to clean anything
customer_reviews.author: eccentric hierophant

customer_reviews.title: Excellent popcorn maker. No problems. YOU control batch size.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves popcorn. So the microwave bags were piling up lol. Its easier for us to put the correct amount in for large or small batches. Machine works great.
customer_reviews.author: T. Hollins

customer_reviews.title: My husband wonders why they have not added an on/off switch like other manufacturers
customer_reviews.text: I've always preferred presto for my hot air poppers. This one works well and red is my color, so added bonus there. My husband wonders why they have not added an on/off switch like other manufacturers. It doesn't bother me tho. The only thing I would change is to go back to the old chute design that was wide at the exit.
customer_reviews.author: AnM

customer_reviews.title: Overall a great popper
customer_reviews.text: Really love this popper. Healthier and fast. The negative: some pieces and kernels sometimes fly away. I prevent this by draping a light hand towel over the machine and bowl while popping and it contains everything without getting too hot. Easy fix.
customer_reviews.author: Julia E

customer_reviews.title: Dead in 4 months
customer_reviews.text: Works good but it started to concern me when the top started to melt where the measuring cup is. Only had it for 4 months and used maybe 12 times before i plugged in and just saw a puff of smoke and it stopped working. waste of money. the one my parents have from 25 years ago still is working and never melted the plastic. tells me cheap parts and plastic.
customer_reviews.author: GpHUnK

customer_reviews.title: Nice at first..
customer_reviews.text: It’s gets really hot and sparks at the electric outlet when unplugging. Wish it had an on/off button. Very dangerous. Which I had gotten a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: tsaunders

customer_reviews.title: Presto Poplite hot air corn popper
customer_reviews.text: This product spits the unpeopled kernels out before the machine gets hot enough to pop them - the only way it worked was if I tilted the machine up to prevent the kernels from flying out before they were popped.
customer_reviews.author: E. R. White

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: Awesome Popcorn popper if you don't mind the noise. Air popped popcorn makes for a healthy treat until you use the built in butter melter and then put that on the top. The only downside is the product is it is larger than shown in the picture.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Pruett

customer_reviews.title: Nifty air popper at this price.
customer_reviews.text: Nifty Air Popper. Can make oil free popcorn in a flash...faster than the microwave and tons cheaper. Almost every kernel pops. Seen some reviews warning against using small popcorn seeds.... I've used big and small with no problems. At most, half a dozen unpopped seeds get blown out into the bowl before popping (with smaller seeds).
customer_reviews.author: DocSiders

customer_reviews.title: Quick easy way to make air pop popcorn!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Pop a couple batches first and get the smells out (plastic and metallic smells at first), after that, it pops corn lquick and easily. Don't pop too many batches in a row though or it will likely melt the plastic, it gets very hot.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: Kind of a disappoinment. I got this as a present for someone based off me having a another model of the popcorn maker. This maker is small but the popcorn pops out the front when it isn't even finished. After the end of your serving there are a lot of unpopped kernels. Not great.
customer_reviews.author: Chantel Nicastro

customer_reviews.title: Great popper!!
customer_reviews.text: work fine, in my opinion, it should have an on/off switch
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Lima

customer_reviews.title: Red butter holder melts and cracks
customer_reviews.text: The popper works great. However the red butter holder melter has bubbled and cracked. Now I have To use a glass plate which slides off constantly so I have To hold it in place. I dont Recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: josh Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Died within a month
customer_reviews.text: Was fantastic until it stopped working within a month. Just died one day.
customer_reviews.author: J. Le

customer_reviews.title: This has become my favorite appliance ever
customer_reviews.text: This has become my favorite appliance ever. 2 rounds feed my 5 kids, my husband, and myself. I can control the salt and butter. Everyone says it doesn't pop all the corn, but it's within reason. Microwave popcorn has more kernels left. This is the best gift ever!
customer_reviews.author: A567

customer_reviews.title: Melted after a year of occasional use.
customer_reviews.text: After a year and a half of occasion use. Guess it overheated.
customer_reviews.author: Julissa Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe - a fire hazard
customer_reviews.text: Bought this exactly one year ago. Does sometimes give off a "burning smell". Last night (11/28/18) used it, a spark came out from where you put the popcorn. I immediately unplugged it and took it outside as I didn't know if it was going to explode. DO NOT BUY!!! FIRE HAZARD
customer_reviews.author: Stormin Odie

customer_reviews.title: ... directions to the T and this popcorn maker makes great popcorn. We spray some olive oil on it ...
customer_reviews.text: We follow the directions to the T and this popcorn maker makes great popcorn. We spray some olive oil on it and a little popcorn salt and it is delicious.
customer_reviews.author: LindaG

customer_reviews.title: Lean mean popping machine
customer_reviews.text: The hot air pushing the corn around will spin unpopped corn kernels out into your serving bowel. All I do is toss them right backk in as its just a few. This dry air popper is a lean mean popping machine.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey Wells

customer_reviews.title: and annoying.
customer_reviews.text: Beware of buying kernels too lite to cook. We bought a slew of popping corn only to have it blown out of the maker as soon as you turn it on. Really disappointing, and annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Brds74

customer_reviews.title: Poor reliability
customer_reviews.text: Purchased on 9/3/17, Amazon's return closed on 10/6/17, motor burned out - stopped working on 11/4/17. Only worked for 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: Cyberdude

customer_reviews.title: Pops every kernel every time
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over two years now, and I have to say I LOVE it. It pops all my popcorn completely! Love the ability to make at-home popcorn for movie nights.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Kantor

customer_reviews.title: Pops very well
customer_reviews.text: Great popcorn with no added fat. This pops nearly every kernel, is super easy to use, and cleans up in a snap. I use it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: B. Ross

customer_reviews.title: A good product. As advertised.
customer_reviews.text: A good product. As advertised. The only upgrade to this simple machine would be an on/off switch.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Harris

customer_reviews.title: Works for me!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it. If you make a small bowl (fewer cornels) some of the cornels will blow out before popping. I typically make a large batch (Tupperware container) and put some in a smaller bowl to eat. Tupperware container seals tight to keep popcorn fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley K.

customer_reviews.title: A total mess
customer_reviews.text: Blows too many kernels out and makes a huge mess. I use a huge mixing bowl,, but the opening is too wide to direct the corn into the bowl without a mess
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Makes a wonderful gift!
customer_reviews.text: We love our air popcorn popper, and I've bought this several times as gifts. It makes a wonderful bridal shower or christmas gift paired with some gourmet popcorn and some popcorn flavorings!
customer_reviews.author: Caleb Mast

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst thing I have bought! Right when I plugged it in it turned off and smelled like burnt. I can’t even put one star.
customer_reviews.author: nasrin

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Noisy but works awesomely, we love it better than microwave popcorn.
customer_reviews.author: Ray Clark

customer_reviews.title: Pops nearly every kernel !
customer_reviews.text: This is a great corn popper which pops nearly every kernel. The only improvement I would suggest is to add an “off and on” button. You turn it on and off by pulling the plug out of the electrical socket. I have a preference for turning it off and on by pushing a button.
customer_reviews.author: Jacquelyn Sneed

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than the 8 year old model I was replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: I don't like it
customer_reviews.text: It works ok. The popcorn doesn't come out crisp. Chewy, like it's stale. It's a brand new jar. Going back to my old Stir Crazy.
customer_reviews.author: JohnM

customer_reviews.title: 100% would not recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This stopped working within 3 months of purchasing after only a handful of uses. Simply doesn't turn on anymore. Very frustrating as we bought it to replace the air popper we had been using without issue for over 5 years. 100% would not recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew J Miller

customer_reviews.title: This popper is just a cheap mess. The unit ...
customer_reviews.text: This popper is just a cheap mess. The unit does not get hot enough to make the popcorn crunchy, there is no off/on switch, and the popcorn sprays everywhere. Do not even think about buying this.
customer_reviews.author: Big Gouda

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy low calorie popcorn
customer_reviews.text: Getting 99% popped kernels compared to the store bought bags of “healthy” popcorn that are half full and have the little crunchy kernels compared to the fully popped Kernel.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Sides

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Gift for a friend of mine. She loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Christina F.

customer_reviews.title: I have used the Presto Poplite 5-6 times and Wow ...
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Presto Poplite 5-6 times and Wow, for $16.00 it exceeded my expectations. I warmed it up for 10 seconds, filled the red tray to the top each time and poured it in. Each time I ended up with just a few unpopped kernels. FYI...don't buy the cheapest popcorn or you'll probably get more unpopped kernels.
customer_reviews.author: MDD

customer_reviews.title: had this years ago. got it as a gift ...
customer_reviews.text: had this years ago .got it as a gift for my 5 yr old grandson for xmas..he loves it
customer_reviews.author: barbara d.

customer_reviews.title: It makes popcorn, and does it well.
customer_reviews.text: So far, after about four weeks of use, the product continues to work well, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Troy

customer_reviews.title: I love popcorn.
customer_reviews.text: I love popcorn.....love love love it! This pops the corn in nice big pieces and it does it quickly. Would recommend this one to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Works very well but spits the kernels out before ready. Solution is to tilt it backwards a little until they start popping
customer_reviews.author: Lp

customer_reviews.title: ... this on a regular basis and are getting consistently great results. Great buy
customer_reviews.text: We are using this on a regular basis and are getting consistently great results. Great buy.....

customer_reviews.title: Broke after the first week. We were so excited ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke after the first week. We were so excited to have our first bowl and all we could smell was burning appliance.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Made a coffee bean roaster with this. I had to bypass the thermostat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love this popper
customer_reviews.text: I love this popper, my parents had one and the popcorn tasted so good, so now I have one too!
customer_reviews.author: Stacy Diane Lobsinger

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted
customer_reviews.text: I am extremely disappointed. I just received the popcorn popper and it had butter oil on the outside along with popcorn hulls in the popper and in the crevices. Extremely frustrates and spent $33 on this
customer_reviews.author: Shannon D.

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Very simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Very simple to use, easy clean up. Just don’t over-fill, and it pops perfectly

customer_reviews.title: and is much better.
customer_reviews.text: Takes no more time than microwave popcorn, and is much better.

customer_reviews.title: Love air-popped popcorn
customer_reviews.text: The only complaint I have is how hot the machine gets externally. Can definitely cause burns if not handled with the up most care.

customer_reviews.title: Happily used it for all of 3 months
customer_reviews.text: Happily used it for all of 3 months. Now the motor doesn't work. Back to toxic microwave popcorn until I buy another air popper.

customer_reviews.title: POP AWAY
customer_reviews.text: have not tried it yet but Presto makes quality products

customer_reviews.text: Poorly designed. Most of the kernels are forced out of the popper before they can get hot enough to pop.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My kids just place the popcorn with the measuring cup which is on top and plug the machine.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great machine I make popcorn cakes and this makes the ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine I make popcorn cakes and this makes the task go much faster. The minus is that it does not have an on off switch. You have to plug in and unplug each time.

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works great except the first one failed after 1 day.

customer_reviews.title: ... as "fluffy" as expected (as microwave) But the kids love it and trying to NOT use the microwave
customer_reviews.text: Popcorn isn't as "fluffy" as expected (as microwave) But the kids love it and trying to NOT use the microwave version

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after less than 10 uses.
customer_reviews.text: This could be my worst Amazon purchase in the 17 years I've been an Amazon customer. I've had this product less than 2 months, and used it less than 10x, and it's already stopped working. Extremely disappointing.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't last
customer_reviews.text: Worked about 10 times - made it through about 80% of the 2lb bottle of kernels over the 2 mos we had it. Oh well, it was inexpensive...

customer_reviews.title: Disposable popcorn maker (except the plastic will remain for years)

customer_reviews.title: Nice popper

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This item works great and nice to have a pop of color in the kitchen (red).

customer_reviews.title: It's beautiful

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise all is well and I am happy.
customer_reviews.text: This hot air popper is exactly how it is described in the description section. BUT, there was a surprise...there is no ON/OFF switch. It is operated by plugging it in the outlet and unplugging it when you are done. Otherwise all is well and I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: Kä·desh'

customer_reviews.title: This thing works better then I could have imagined

customer_reviews.title: Made a mess, and could cause cancer..?
customer_reviews.text: The first time I used it, un-popped kernels started flying out of the opening, and it seems all of a sudden, all the kernels popped at once, and jammed up the escape vent, and the top was forced off, and popcorn and kernels went flying everywhere.. what a mess. I did smell a weird chemical smell when it was running, and now I read in the reviews that, as stated in the instruction booklet, there is a chemical in the machine that causes cancer.. darn it.. was hoping for a good purchase. May have to return it... they need to remove the cancer causing agent.

product_meta.title: Presto 04864 Poplite Hot Air Popper, White
product_meta.description: Color:WhiteThe PopLite corn popper pops with hot air, not oil, for a healthy, low-calorie snack. It offers a faster, healthier, and more economical choice to microwave bag popcorn. It pops regular or gourmet popcorn with virtually no unpopped kernels! Up to 18 cups of gourmet popcorn are popped in less than 2 1/2 minutes. Butter melter doubles as a handy measuring cup.
feature_bullets: Pops with hot air, not oil, for a low-fat treat. Virtually no unpopped kernels
Faster, healthier, and more economical than most microwave bag popcorn. Faster than a microwave. Pops up to 18 cups of gourmet corn in less than 2 1/2 minutes
Good for you. Hot air popcorn is all natural with no artificial flavors, saturated fats, preservatives, or added salt
Economical. Uses regular gourmet popcorn for about a third of the cost of microwave bags
Easy to clean. Pops without oil so base and cover simply wipe clean

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars371 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
